snippet: The police said Mansur Ball-Bey, 18, continued to run after he was shot, but the chief St. Louis medical examiner said the youth was most likely “incapacitated immediately.”
abstract: St Louis medical examiner says Mansur Ball-Bey, 18-year-old  black man who was shot by police officers, died from bullet that entered middle of his back and lodged near his rib cage; report finds that wound would likely have felled Ball-Bey immediately, calling into question police claims that he continued to run after being shot.
lead_paragraph: The police said Mansur Ball-Bey, 18, continued to run after he was shot, but the chief St. Louis medical examiner said the youth was most likely “incapacitated immediately.”

headline.main: Black Man Shot by Police in St. Louis Died From Bullet to Back
headline.print_headline: Black Man Shot by Police in St. Louis Died From a Bullet to His Back
